text.0: from thee as branches from a tree o agni from thee auspicious god spring all our blessings.
text.1: wealth swiftly strength in battle with our foemen the rain besought of heaven the flow of waters.
text.2: thou art our bhaga to send wealth thou dwellest like circumambient air with wondrous splendour.
text.3: friend art thou of the lofty law like mitra controller agni god of many a blessing.
text.4: agni the hero slays with might his foeman the singer bears away the paṇis booty.
text.5: even he whom thou sage born in law incitest by wealth accordant with the child of waters.
text.6: the man who son of strength  with sacrifices hymns lauds attracts thy fervour to the altar.
text.7: enjoys each precious thing o god o agni gains wealth of corn and is the lord of treasures.
text.8: grant son of strength to men for their subsistence such things as bring high fame and hero children.
text.9: for thou with might givest much food in cattle even to the wicked wolf when he is hungry.
text.10: eloquent son of strength most mighty agni vouchsafe us seed and offspring full of vigour.
text.11: may i by all my songs obtain abundance may brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.
